text:
(1) Pearl Street, west side, south from but not including Coenties Alley, to, but not including Broad Street. The view shows Public School No. 134 at No. 67 Pearl Street, south of Coenties Alley. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south). September 20, 1929.

(2) The same, from a slightly different angle. April 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a closer view. Notice boy ringing old fashioned hand bell (a custom adhered to at this school). May 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH
title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley

text:

title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley

text:
77-81 Pearl Street, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Coenties Alley, as seen through clearance on Water Street. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south when north of Coenties Slip).

June 20, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley

text:
69 Pearl Street, north side, west of Coenties Alley. Note a portion of the steel support for the bend, which the Second and Third Aves., Elevated makes at this point.

September 6, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST.
title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley
